meanings.definition: Most sedate or serious in character; not flighty or capricious.
meanings.sent1: She was the staidest person in the room, always calm and composed.
meanings.sent2: The librarian's staidest rule was to keep quiet in the reading area.
meanings.sent3: Even the mischievous puppy couldn't disrupt the staidest cat in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: His staidest demeanor cracked when he heard the unexpected joke.
meanings.sent5: The staidest oak tree stood tall and unwavering in the storm.

meanings.definition: Most settled or permanent in nature; not easily moved or changed.
meanings.sent1: The staidest building in town had been there for over a century.
meanings.sent2: Her staidest decision was to live in the same house her whole life.
meanings.sent3: The staidest rock in the garden never budged, no matter how hard the wind blew.
meanings.sent4: The staidest mountain overlooked the valley, unmoved by the passing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The staidest clock on the wall ticked steadily, marking the unchanging hours.
